articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Leaves Kampala
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves Kampala
 Kampala, November 1 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, left Kampala on Saturday after wrapping up his official goodwill visit to the Republic of Uganda.
					 Leaving together with him were Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Kil Bok, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, and other suite members.
					
					 They were seen off by Asuman Kiyingi, acting foreign minister, and other officials concerned, Myong Kyong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Uganda, and his embassy staff members.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Back Home
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Back Home 
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA), Monday returned home after wrapping up his official goodwill visits to Sudan, Congo and Uganda.
					 Returning home together with him were Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Kil Bok, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, and other suite members.
					
					 They were greeted at the airport by Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the SPA Presidium, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to Ugandan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Thanks to Ugandan President
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Saturday sent a message of thanks to Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of the Republic of Uganda, leaving it after successfully wrapping up his visit to the country.
					 He in the message expressed thanks to the president, government and people of Uganda for according warm reception and cordial hospitality to him and his party.
					
					 The message said they could witness for themselves rapid progress the Ugandan people have made in politics, economy, military affairs and various other fields under the leadership of the president and the government of the Uganda National Resistance Movement.
					
					 It noted that at the talks and conversations with the president and senior officials of the Ugandan government during the visit both sides had sincere discussions on the mutual stands of steadily boosting the bilateral relations and reached a consensus of views on them.
					
					 The message noted with satisfaction that the visit undoubtedly marked an important occasion in further deepening the mutual understanding and friendship and further promoting the development of the relations between the two countries.
					
					 It sincerely wished the Ugandan people greater progress in the efforts to build prosperous Uganda and the president good health and great success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Congratulations to Mozambican President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Mozambican President
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Saturday sent a message to Filipe Nwussi, hailing another victory won by the Mozambique Liberation Front Party in the general election held in Mozambique and congratulating him on his election as Mozambican president.
					 The message said that the outcome of the recent general election is an expression of the people's deep trust and great expectation for the president and the Mozambique Liberation Front Party.
					
					 Convinced that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries with a long history and tradition would steadily grow stronger, the message wished the president success in his responsible work for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Vice-President of SPA Presidium Meets Czech Ambassador
articles.content:
Vice-President of SPA Presidium Meets Czech Ambassador
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Dusan Strauch, Czech ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.

articles.title: 25th National Software Contest and Exhibition
articles.content:
25th National Software Contest and Exhibition
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The 25th National Software Contest and Exhibition took place here on October 21-28.
					 What drew the attention of visitors were more than 140 programs presented by Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					 Among them are universal rolling process program, which has been proved successful in the production of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, and tele-education software.
					
					 Multilingual character recognition software also won high appraisal among visitors for its effectiveness in learning foreign languages.

articles.title: Guidelines for Protection of National Heritage
articles.content:
Guidelines for Protection of National Heritage
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, recently made public his work "To Protect National Heritage Is a Patriotic Undertaking for Adding Brilliance to the History and Traditions of Our Nation" on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's field guidance to Mausoleum of King Tangun.
					 The work clearly indicates the way of adding luster to cultural tradition of the Korean nation.
					
					 In this regard, Jong Song Il, a section chief of the Folklore Institute under the Academy of Social Sciences of the DPRK, told KCNA as follows:
					
					 The work shows the firm will of the Workers' Party of Korea to glorify the country as an advanced and highly civilized state in the world and a prosperous and strong nation with the time-honored history and brilliant culture, true to the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The work underscores the need to restore historical remains and relics to their original state, retain excellent traditions, conduct the work for protecting the national heritage as the nationwide and all-people one and put it on a scientific basis.
					
					 We, historians and archaeologists, have not paid due attention to preserving historical remains and relics in some parts of the country, under the pretext of difficult economic situation of the country.
					
					 But the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un in his work highly praised those people as patriots and unassuming men of meritorious service for devoting themselves to protecting national heritages even in remote areas.
					
					 We will devote our all to displaying the excellence of the Korean nation, in hearty response to his noble intention to glorify the precious cultural tradition of the Korean nation for all ages.

articles.title: Premier League Football Matches Come to End
articles.content:
Premier League Football Matches Come to End
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Premier league football matches for the DPRK Championships finished in Pyongyang.
					 In the 40 day-long competition, the Hwaebul Team came first in the men's event with seven wins, three draws and one defeat and the Pyongyang Team in the women's event with nine wins and two defeats.
					
					 The April 25 Team and the Amnokgang Team took the second places respectively in the men's and women's events.
					
					 A total of 377 goals were witnessed in the league matches with 12 men's and 12 women's teams attended.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket Is Bound to Go Bust: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket Is Bound to Go Bust: Rodong Sinmun 
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The ever-more undisguised "human rights" racket of the south Korean authorities is a blatant challenge to the dignity and system of the DPRK and an intolerable politically motivated provocation to it, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The reckless leaflet scattering operations chilling the hard-won atmosphere of mending the north-south relations and their catastrophic consequences bring to light the confrontational nature of the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket of the south Korean puppet authorities. 
					
					 The north and the south of Korea should pave the way for improving the relations and achieving reconciliation and unity while recognizing the differing ideologies and social systems. 
					
					 It is precisely for this reason that the DPRK repeatedly urged the present south Korean authorities to stop hostile acts of slandering the north and made sincere efforts to defuse distrust and confrontation between the north and the south and create an atmosphere of mending the inter-Korean relations on its own initiative.
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities responded to the north's urge by more undisguisedly kicking up the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket, far from creating the atmosphere of mending the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 Frontline units of south Korean puppet army and flying corps of its air force were put on emergency alert when the leaflet-scattering operation was conducted by human scum in south Korea most recently. This fact helps people easily understand what is the target of the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket of the south Korean authorities. 
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that the south Korean puppet group is a gang of traitors escalating the confrontation between the fellow countrymen and bringing the dark clouds of a new war to gather over the Korean Peninsula by kicking up the "human rights" racket in collusion with outside forces in utter disregard of the improvement of the north-south relations and destiny of the nation. 
					
					 This "human rights" racket of the south Korean puppet group is bound to go bust as it is diametrically running counter to the aspiration of the nation for mending of the north-south relations and achieving peace and independent reunification of the country and the trend of the times.

articles.title: U.S. Accused of Backing Anti-DPRK Leaflet Scattering Operation
articles.content:
U.S. Accused of Backing Anti-DPRK Leaflet Scattering Operation
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea released a statement on Oct. 31 denouncing the U.S. for backing the anti-DPRK leaflet scattering operation behind the scene.
					 Due to the leaflet scattering operation, inhabitants in the area near the military demarcation line are seized with constant uneasiness and the hard-won atmosphere of improving the north-south relations is in the danger of being spoiled, the statement deplored.
					
					 Querying why the leaflet scattering of conservative organizations is going on and who patronizes and finances it, the statement clarified as follows:
					
					 The leaflet scattering operation has been intensified since the adoption of the "north Korean human rights act" in the U.S. in 2004.
					
					 The "act" stipulates that the U.S. president shall provide financial aid to NGOs to help them conduct actions hurting the social system in north Korea.
					
					 After shaping the budget called "the fund for human rights and democracy", the U.S. has funded the organizations of "defectors from the north", targeting the "collapse of the social system in the north".
					
					 Since 2008, Washington has provided a fabulous amount of money to the anti-DPRK conspiratorial organizations and conservative media under the pretence of settling "the human rights issue in the north".
					
					 Notably, the leaflet scattering operation is impossible in the demilitarized zone without permission of the U.S. as the zone is under the control of the U.S. in actuality. 
					
					 The military tension escalating between the south and the north these days is attributable to the U.S. zealous backing of these operations behind the scene, the statement said, urging the U.S. to stop at once its acts of threatening the life and security of the  people and deteriorating the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: All-People Memorial Rally Held in Seoul
articles.content:
All-People Memorial Rally Held in Seoul
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- An all-people memorial rally took place at Chonggye Plaza in Seoul on Nov. 1, 200 days since the ferry Sewol disaster in south Korea.
					 It was attended by members of civic and public organizations, citizens, housewives, students and other people of all social standings, more than 20 000 in all.
					
					 At the rally speakers deplored that those missing have not yet been found out and the truth about the disaster has not been probed though 200 days have passed since the disaster.
					
					 They declared they would carry on the on-going actions to thoroughly probe the truth about the disaster, make those involved in it be punished and build a safe society.
					
					 Then the participants staged a demonstration as far as Seoul Square.
					
					After reaching Seoul Square, they held another rally at which they declared they would continue the actions till the truth about the disaster is probed.
					
					 Meanwhile, a memorial rally took place at the incense-burning altar in Ansan, Kyonggi Province on the same day under the sponsorship of the Measure Committee of the Families of Victims, Missing Persons and Survivors of the Ferry Sewol Accident.

articles.title: S. Korean Public Servants and Teachers Stage Mammoth Protest Rally against Regime
articles.content:
S. Korean Public Servants and Teachers Stage Mammoth Protest Rally against Regime
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- According to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People, there took place a mammoth rally in Youido, Seoul on Nov. 1 in protest against the south Korean regime's move for the retrogressive revision of the law on pension for public servants.
					 It was attended by at least 120 000 members of more than 50 public servants and teachers organizations from across south Korea.
					
					 Speakers said that they could never accept a unilateral retrogressive revision of the "law on a pension for public servants" made by the "Saenuri Party" and the "government", disregarding the opinions of the government employees and teachers.
					
					 They called on everybody to unite and struggle to foil the regime's move.
					
					 In a resolution the participants at the rally said that they would launch actions, representing the resentment of eight million public servants and teachers and their families if the regime and the ruling party press forward the revision, indifferent to their living after their retirement.
					
					 They also warned that they would bring forward a non-confidence motion against the authorities in case they go on with the de-nationalization of public domain on the side of the tycoons.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A Karelia, Russia, committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated on Oct. 28.
					 Viktor Yegorov, chairman of the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia, was elected chairman of the memorial committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize a lecture, remembrance meeting and other political and cultural events praising the greatness and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il from Oct. 28 to Dec. 19.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Romania
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Romania
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" was held at the building of the Socialist Party of Romania on Oct. 28.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the party, explained the main contents of the work and went on to say:
					
					 Kim Jong Il published the work on Nov. 1, 1994 when the world socialist movement experienced a temporary frustration, saving the socialist movement from a crisis and proving the sure victory of socialism as a science.
					
					 He made a scientific clarification of the validity and truth of socialism, giving perfect answers to all issues arising in the development of the socialist movement.
					
					 His ideological and theoretical exploits, indeed, occupy the most important and brilliant place in the history of human thought.
					
					 His exploits will always be remembered by progressive humankind.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 The speakers praised him for developing the socialist movement and expressed belief that the army and people of the DPRK would certainly accomplish the cause of building a thriving nation under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Is Sure to Win Confrontation with U.S.: Nigerian Body
articles.content:
DPRK Is Sure to Win Confrontation with U.S.: Nigerian Body
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article titled "History of DPRK-U.S. relations" on its website on Oct. 26.
					 The ties between the DPRK and the U.S. precisely mean the ones of confrontation, the article said.
					
					 The article cited the facts to prove that the history of the historic confrontation between the DPRK and the U.S. which has lasted for decades shows that the DPRK has always emerged victorious while the U.S. has sustained setbacks only.
					
					 The DPRK, convinced that both time and justice are in store for it, is getting ready for winning the final victory in the showdown with the U.S. while bolstering up its military muscle in every way, it said.
					
					 This history of the relations between the DPRK and the U.S. characterized by the certain victory of the DPRK and the defeat of the U.S. will go on till the DPRK wins the final victory in the confrontation with the U.S., the article concluded.

articles.title: Federal Formula Is Only Way for Peaceful Reunification of Korea: Kuwaiti Paper
articles.content:
Federal Formula Is Only Way for Peaceful Reunification of Korea: Kuwaiti Paper
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The Oct. 28 issue of the Kuwaiti paper Al－Anba carried an article titled "Federal formula is only way for peaceful reunification of Korea" accompanied by a photo of leader Kim Jong Il meeting with former south Korean President Roh Moo Hyun.
					 The paper said:
					
					 The DPRK-proposed federal formula calls for reunifying the country by a federal formula on the basis of the great national unity, allowing the differing ideologies and social systems in the north and the south of Korea as they are.
					
					 Several decades have passed since the federal formula was proposed, but it is still fully supported by the Koreans in the north and the south and abroad as it is the only proposal for preventing military conflict and averting a war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK) is one of the main contents of the three charters for national reunification formulated by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Lots of initiatives and proposals have been made so far to solve the issue of national reunification but the proposal for founding the DFRK is the most realistic and reasonable one for ensuring peace and security on the peninsula and realizing the cherished desire of the Korean people for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country free from any foreign interference.
					
					 The Korean people and the world progressives wish to see the federal formula put into practice, the Korean Peninsula reunified and peace, security and stability ensured there.

articles.title: Sera fracasada la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC, sentencia Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Sera fracasada la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC, sentencia Rodong Sinmun 
						
Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual divulgado este lunes, el diario Rodong Sinmun califica la cada dia mas brutal campana de "DDHH", que libran las autoridades surcoreanas contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, como intolerable provocacion politica y desafio frontal a la dignidad y regimen de la RPDC. 
					El lanzamiento de volantes de contenido anti-RPDC, que congela el ambiente favorable a la mejora de relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas, y sus consecuencias catastroficas revelan claramente la esencia conflictiva de la susodicha ofensiva, apunta el articulista y continua:
					
					Ambas partes coreanas deben mejorar las relaciones bilaterales y lograr la reconciliacion y unidad reconociendo la diferente ideologia y regimen de la contraparte. 
					
					Para ese fin, la RPDC propuso reiteradamente a las actuales autoridades surcoreanas parar los actos hostiles y calumnias a la contraparte y realizo esfuerzos sinceros y protagonicos por eliminar la desconfianza y antagonismo entre ambas partes y crear el ambiente favorable a la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Pero, las autoridades surcoreanas respondieron con recrudecer la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC. 
					
					Cuando unas escorias humanas cometian en suelo surcoreano el lanzamiento de volantes anti-RPDC, las unidades en el frente y hasta la aviacion del ejercito titere surcoreano entraron en el estado de emergencia, lo cual insinua cual es el objetivo de la campana en cuestion. 
					
					La realidad evidencia que los titeres surcoreanos son traidores que agravan la confrontacion fratricida y buscan la guerra de agresion contra la RPDC recurriendo a la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras sin tomar en consideracion el destino de la nacion. 
					
					Esta condenada al fracaso la campana de "DDHH" de los titeres surcoreanos que desafian frontalmente a la tendencia de la epoca y a la aspiracion nacional al mejoramiento de relaciones intercoreanas, la paz y la reunificacion independiente del pais.

articles.title: Regresa a Pyongyang Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Regresa a Pyongyang Kim Yong Nam
　Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, regreso el dia 3 a la patria tras terminar una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica de Sudan, la Republica del Congo y la Republica de Uganda.
					  Vinieron juntos aqui el ministro de Salud Publica Kang Ha Guk, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero So Kil Bok y otros acompanantes.
					
					  En el aeropuerto les acogieron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS de la RPDC Kim Yong Dae y otros funcionarios.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presenta orientacion para conservar patrimonios nacionales
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un presenta orientacion para conservar patrimonios nacionales
						
Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un presento las medidas a ser tomadas en la conservacion de los patrimonios nacionales para glorificar la magnifica tradicion cultural de la nacion coreana.
					Asi dijo a la ACNC, Jong Song Il, jefe de la seccion del Instituto de Folclore de la Academia de Ciencias Sociales de Corea y continuo:
					
					El Mariscal Kim Jong Un publico la obra "La conservacion del patrimonio nacional es una labor patriotica destinada a hacer valer la historia y la tradicion de nuestra nacion" con motivo del 20o aniversario de la direccion en el terreno del Dirigente Kim Jong Il al mausoleo de Tangun. 
					
					La obra es el documento programatico que muestra la firme voluntad del Partido del Trabajo de Corea de hacer brillar nuestro pais como pais avanzado y civilizado de talla mundial de larga historia y brillante cultura y como potencia prospera en acato al noble proposito del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Me quede impresionado ante su idea de  conservar y cuidar en status quo las reliquias y vestigios historicos, revivir las excelentes tradiciones nacionales, proteger los patrimonios nacionales con la movilizacion de todo el pais y todo el pueblo y elevar su nivel cientifico.
					
					El Mariscal Kim Jong Un conocio en detalles de los trabajos de los patriotas y benemeritos del sector de la conservacion de patrimonio nacional quienes las cuidan con toda su alma en sus puestos.
					
					Nuestros cientificos dedicaran todas inteligencias y entusiasmos a la labor por exaltar la superioridad de la nacion guardando como fe el noble proposito del Mariscal Kim Jong Un de hacer valer la tradicion cultural de la nacion coreana.

articles.title: Terminada liga de futbol de categoria A del Campeonato Nacional
articles.content:
Terminada liga de futbol de categoria A del Campeonato Nacional
						
Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Termino la liga de futbol de categoria A del Campeonato Nacional que transcurrio en esta capital durante mas de 40 dias. 
					Entre los onces masculinos resulto ganador el Hwaebul (7 victorias, 3 empates y una derrota) y entre los femeninos, vencio el Pyongyang (9 victorias y 2 derrotas).
					
					La seleccion masculina 25 de Abril y la femenina Amnokgang se quedaron en el segundo lugar debido a las desventajas en los goles a favor y en contra. 
					
					Hwaebul ocupo el tercer lugar en el Campeonato Nacional del ano pasado y el segundo lugar en la competencia de futbol por la copa Antorcha efectuada en agosto de este ano.
					
					Las muchachas del equipo Pyongyang ocuparon el tercer lugar en la competencia de futbol efectuada en septiembre pasado en homenaje al dia de fundacion de la RPDC. 
					
					En la presente liga participaron doce equipos masculinos e igual numero de femeninos.
					
					En los juegos realizados a modo de todos contra todos se registraron 377 goles en total.
